message: I am using twilight!
I'm using my own: https://github.com/tauil/emacs-designer-kit/blob/master/color-theme/themes/color-theme-schwarz.el
I am using zen-and-art: https://github.com/irfn/zen-and-art, a screenshot can be found here: https://github.com/irfn/zen-and-art/raw/master/zen-and-art-emacs.png

I'm also using twilight, but with a few changes: https://github.com/inkel/twilight-emacs
And I'm planning to customize it a bit further.

I am on the Greiner color theme, built into Emacs 23, and probably quite a few before it. For night-hacking, I use the redshift tool (Linux - similar beasts for the Jobsian religion and Ballmersian religion users). Redshift alters the color temperature of the screen.

A slightly modified version of zenburn. I'm liking the look of zen-and-art, though. Might give it a try.
https://github.com/sellout/emacs-color-theme-solarized
here
http://imgur.com/uhwjR

The solarized project is very interesting, and seeing all the contributions for various editors and terminals has motivated me to spend a lot of time tweaking my own color scheme choices, but I have to say I'm not a big fan of the teal-ish background. The light background is nice, but the dark background just looks bland and old-fashioned to me for some reason.

On a hunch, I decided to try inverting the color scheme, and the light scheme turns into a very nice dark-blue background scheme which I could definitely see myself using. The now-light background's a little pinkish, but not bad either.
